result.execSummary:
The defendant Anna B Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate State/County Institution Laws [Modifiers: Repeater], a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.73.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $100 fine plus costs.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. To pay supervision fees as ordered by the Dept. of Corrections.
Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

timeConds.notes: Huber release granted. 60 days to report.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: from defendant requesting good time credit. Court responds - this is conditions time for probation, no good time. DTE
DA's response to defendants request for good time credit. DA advises jail time is a condition of probation so no good time. JMK
from Tom & Pamela Olson on defendants behalf.

Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Minute sheet. Court reviews events in file. State amends charge to Violate State/County Institution Laws, 946.73 as a repeater.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to amended charge.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds plea made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds guilty of amended charge. State gives recommendation, makes sentencing statement. Defense gives sentencing argument. Court makes statement, imposes sentence.

Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Gerbers indicates he doesn't feel comfortable proceeding, hasn't had enough time to look at discovery and discuss matter with defendant. Atty Gerbers requests another status in October. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.  Status conference scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 02:15 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Anna B Olson
Current: 103 N. Duluth Ave., Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235   (Effective: 06-16-2014)
Prior: Door County Jail, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

Defendant Anna B Olson in court with attorney Eric S Maciolek.  Defendant Anna B Olson in custody.  Raymond L Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limit for prelim. Set for prelim. Bond set.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/10/14 by jail staff. (fingerprint card destroyed 10/15/14)
